channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Gunman argued with mum before attack
item.description: The five victims, including a father and daughter out walking their dog, were killed in Plymouth.

item.title: Sheffield hotel fall: Boy who died was Afghan refugee
item.description: The five-year-old boy and his family arrived in the UK just two weeks ago.

item.title: Prison guard demanded sexual favours from inmates
item.description: David Whitfield is jailed over the illicit activity with 12 women over five years.

item.title: Ex-MP Jared O'Mara charged with seven counts of fraud
item.description: Jared O'Mara is charged in relation to alleged fraudulent expenses claims, the CPS say.

item.title: Stuart Lubbock: Suspect in murder case released without charge
item.description: Stuart Lubbock was found unconscious at Michael Barrymore's house in 2001 and later died.

item.title: Gurkha group ends Downing Street hunger strike after talks agreed
item.description: The group had refused food for 13 days to call for parity with other British Army veterans.

item.title: Queen Cynethryth's 'lost' monastery found next to Cookham church
item.description: Archaeologists from the University of Reading solve a mystery that has long puzzled historians.

item.title: Two men charged over £1m Viking coins hoard
item.description: The haul, recovered in 2019, is believed to be of major historical significance.

item.title: Eileen Barrott murder: Husband detained in Scotland
item.description: Police have been searching for 54-year-old Mark Barrott since Mrs Barrott's death on Sunday.

item.title: Hakeem Hussain: Mum denies killing son by not managing asthma
item.description: Laura Heath also denies child cruelty charges following the death of her boy Hakeem Hussain, seven.

item.title: Afghan interpreter tells of Taliban revenge attack on brother
item.description: Omar, who has recently arrived in Portsmouth, says his brother is now in hiding in Afghanistan.

item.title: Cambridgeshire: Train driver injured in level crossing collision
item.description: The freight train's driver suffered minor injuries as it collided with a tractor, Network Rail says.

item.title: Injured Dubai cat flown to Bradford rescue centre
item.description: The cat was ‘left for dead’ until the centre paid for the transport to West Yorkshire.

item.title: 'I thought I can make a difference'
item.description: A Hull hairdresser who lost his own hair due to cancer is now making wigs to help others.

item.title: Cumbria kidney swap couple recovering after surgery
item.description: The couple joined a national kidney sharing scheme to boost Fiona's chances of finding a donor.

item.title: Plasma donor meets children helped by donations
item.description: A donor from Coventry meets a family from Nottingham whose children who were saved by plasma.

item.title: Pub car park 'rifle' arrest caught on film
item.description: Bodycam footage shows the response of armed police to reports of a man making threats with a rifle.

item.title: Harwich mural 'unlikely to be by Banksy'
item.description: A mural of a boy fishing lacks Banksy's "quality of painting", an expert says.

item.title: George Floyd: Torquay officer warned over offensive meme
item.description: Sgt Geraint Jones admitted gross misconduct and has been given a final written warning.

item.title: Summerseat explosion: Cracked gas main blamed for fatal house blast
item.description: Hospice counsellor Hazel Wilcock died in the house explosion in Summerseat, Bury, on 17 February.

item.title: Rapist's daughter says Birmingham authorities 'wanted case brushed under the carpet'
item.description: Carvel Bennett, 74, was jailed for 1970s rape after his daughter's DNA was used as evidence.

item.title: Recovering birds shot dead at wildlife rehab centre in Hinckley
item.description: Little Souls Wildlife Rescue says 19 birds have been killed in the space of three weeks.

item.title: Azeem Rafiq accuses Yorkshire of downplaying racism by calling him the victim of 'inappropriate behaviour'
item.description: Former player Azeem Rafiq accuses Yorkshire of downplaying racism by calling him the victim of "inappropriate behaviour".

item.title: Lucy Bronze: Manchester City and England defender undergoes knee surgery
item.description: England and Manchester City defender Lucy Bronze undergoes knee surgery and begins her recovery for the new WSL season.

item.title: Patrick Bamford: Leeds United striker signs new five-year contract
item.description: Leeds United striker Patrick Bamford signs a new deal to commit him to the club until 2026.
